name: Guardian Naga
description: A large, serpent-like creature with a humanoid face, known for its wisdom and magical abilities.
memorable: Unique ability to return to life after death, known for its magical defenses and healing.
goals: Protect sacred sites and artifacts, provide guidance and counsel.
relations: Often revered by creatures as a protector and guide.
environment: Often found in sacred sites or ancient temples.
strengths: Highly intelligent, skilled in divine magic, and possesses unique abilities like Rejuvenation and Forbiddance.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to radiant damage and anti-magic effects.
attacks: Can deliver a venomous bite with significant poison damage and spit poison at range.
most_powerful_ability: Rejuvenation, allowing it to return to life in 1d6 days unless prevented by a wish spell.
senses: Possesses heightened perception with a passive score of 18.
skills: Highly skilled in social encounters due to its high Charisma and Wisdom.
additional_information: Amphibious, can breathe both air and water.
Shapeshift ability allows transformation into a Medium humanoid or hybrid.
Spellcasting ability focused on protective and healing spells.
Forbiddance ability protects its lair and damages intruders.
Divine Strikes make its weapon attacks magical, adding extra damage.
spellcasting: An 11th-level spellcaster with a wide range of cleric spells focused on protection and control.
test_queries: large serpent-like guardian with magical abilities
naga that protects sacred sites and artifacts
intelligent magical creature that can return to life
humanoid faced serpent known for wisdom and spells
naga with deadly poison attacks and healing powers
